intro: Cordemoya longistyla, commonly known as the long-styled cordemoyá, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. Cordemoya longistyla is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
